title: Clean Code
description: Clean code can be read and enhanced by a developer other than its original author. With understandability comes readability, changeability, extensibility, and maintainability.

title: Debugging
description: Process of detecting and removing of existing and potential errors or bugs in a software code that can cause it to behave unexpectedly or crash.

title: Problem Solving
description: Using generic or ad hoc methods in an orderly manner to find solutions to problems, especially in computer science.

title: Responsive Design
description: Approach to web design that makes web pages render well on a variety of devices and window or screen sizes.
